multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula ζ(T<sub>w</sub>) = T<sub>w<sup>-1</sup></sub> define?
choices: The multiplication rule for the Iwahori-Matsumoto basis.
An anti-involution on the pro-p-Iwahori Hecke algebra.
The length function on the pro-p Weyl group W(1).
The braid relation in the pro-p-Iwahori Hecke algebra.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula ι(T<sub>w</sub>) = (-1)<sup>ℓ(w)</sup>T<sub>w</sub><sup>∗</sup> define?
choices: A length-preserving automorphism of the pro-p-Iwahori Hecke algebra.
A quadratic relation in the pro-p-Iwahori Hecke algebra.
An involution on the pro-p-Iwahori Hecke algebra.
The dual of a simple module in the pro-p-Iwahori Hecke algebra.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula E<sub>o</sub>(w) ∈ T<sub>w</sub> + ∑<sub>v<w</sub> CT<sub>v</sub> describe?
choices: The definition of the dual basis to the Iwahori-Matsumoto basis.
The decomposition of a spherical orientation basis element into Iwahori-Matsumoto basis elements.
A property of the length function on the pro-p Weyl group W(1).
The definition of the generalized Steinberg module.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula π<sup>ι</sup> = π ◦ ι define?
choices: The dual of a module π in the pro-p-Iwahori Hecke algebra.
The twist of a module π by the involution ι.
The parabolic induction of a module π.
The extension of a module π to a larger Hecke algebra.
